channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Netanyahu submits request for a pardon during his ongoing corruption trial
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel's president to grant him a pardon during his long-running corruption trial that's bitterly divided the country.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel's president to grant him a pardon during his long-running corruption trial that's bitterly divided the country.

(Image credit: Ohad Zwigenberg)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Rubio and Witkoff are meeting with Ukraine's negotiators in Florida as Trump pushes to broker a deal
item.description: Top Trump administration officials are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend, pushing to broker an end to Russia's war in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
Top Trump administration officials are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend, pushing to broker an end to Russia's war in Ukraine.

(Image credit: Martial Trezzini)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: SNAP was restored, but many indigenous Americans still struggle with food insecurity
item.description: During the government shutdown, disruptions in food aid rippled across reservations. Both residents and tribal officials had to make tough choices, and are still feeling the financial impacts.
item.content:encoded:
During the government shutdown, disruptions in food aid rippled across reservations. Both residents and tribal officials had to make tough choices, and are still feeling the financial impacts.

(Image credit: MPSharwood)
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bolton

item.title: AI video slop is everywhere, take our quiz to try and spot it
item.description: There's no one way to be absolutely sure about a video's authenticity, but experts say there are some simple clues that can help.
item.content:encoded:
There's no one way to be absolutely sure about a video's authenticity, but experts say there are some simple clues that can help.

(Image credit: Screenshots by NPR)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: 4 dead and 10 wounded in shooting at banquet hall in Stockton, California
item.description: Four people were killed and 10 wounded in a shooting during a family gathering at a banquet hall in Stockton, sheriff's officials said Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
Four people were killed and 10 wounded in a shooting during a family gathering at a banquet hall in Stockton, sheriff's officials said Saturday.

(Image credit: Ethan Swope)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Northwestern settles with Trump administration in $75M deal to regain federal funding
item.description: The university will pay $75 million over three years to end the Trump administration's investigations into antisemitism on its campus and to have millions of dollars in federal funding restored.
item.content:encoded:
The university will pay $75 million over three years to end the Trump administration's investigations into antisemitism on its campus and to have millions of dollars in federal funding restored.

(Image credit: Teresa Crawford)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: FDA to raise hurdles for vaccines, faulting COVID shots for 10 kids' deaths
item.description: Food and Drug Administration officials say they will ratchet up requirements for vaccine studies, citing concerns about COVID shots for kids. But public health experts question the agency's analysis.
item.content:encoded:
Food and Drug Administration officials say they will ratchet up requirements for vaccine studies, citing concerns about COVID shots for kids. But public health experts question the agency's analysis.

(Image credit: JHVEPhoto)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: A major winter storm disrupts travel as millions head home after Thanksgiving
item.description: The storm will spread through the Midwest and Great Lakes regions over the weekend with "widespread heavy snowfall and hazardous travel conditions," the National Weather Service said.
item.content:encoded:
The storm will spread through the Midwest and Great Lakes regions over the weekend with "widespread heavy snowfall and hazardous travel conditions," the National Weather Service said.

(Image credit: Jared McNett)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88
item.description: Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.
item.content:encoded:
Arcadia, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead and The Coast of Utopia. He's pictured above in London in 2017.'/>

Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.

(Image credit: Justin Tallis/WPA Pool)
item.dc:creator: Tom Vitale

item.title: These Zika mothers went to battle — and their cry was heard
item.description: After the Zika outbreak ended in Brazil, many families faced a new reality: a child whose life was irrevocably altered after the mother contracted the virus while pregnant. Here's what happened next.
item.content:encoded:
After the Zika outbreak ended in Brazil, many families faced a new reality: a child whose life was irrevocably altered after the mother contracted the virus while pregnant. Here's what happened next.

(Image credit: Ian Cheibub for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel
